#Text=CHAPTER III

#Text=A FEW weeks later , coming early one morning into Singapore , from a journey to the southward , I saw the brig lying at anchor in all her usual symmetry and splendour of aspect as though she had been taken out of a glass case and put delicately into the water that very moment .
#Text=She was well out in the roadstead , but I steamed in and took up my habitual berth close in front of the town .
#Text=Before we had finished breakfast a quarter-master came to tell me that Captain Allen ’s boat was coming our way .

#Text=His smart gig dashed alongside , and in two bounds he was up our accommodation-ladder and shaking me by the hand with his nervous grip , his eyes snapping inquisitively , for he supposed I had called at the Seven Isles group on my way .
#Text=I reached into my pocket for a nicely folded little note , which he grabbed out of my hand without ceremony and carried off on the bridge to read by himself .
#Text=After a decent interval I followed him up there , and found him pacing to and fro ; for the nature of his emotions made him restless even in his most thoughtful moments .
#Text=He shook his head at me triumphantly .
#Text=“ Well , my dear boy , ” he said , “ I shall be counting the days now . ”
#Text=I understood what he meant .
#Text=I knew that those young people had settled already on a runaway match without official preliminaries .
#Text=This was really a logical decision .
#Text=Old Nelson ( or Nielsen ) would never have agreed to give up Freya peaceably to this compromising Jasper .
#Text=Heavens !
#Text=What would the Dutch authorities say to such a match !
#Text=It sounds too ridiculous for words .
#Text=But there ’s nothing in the world more selfishly hard than a timorous man in a fright about his “ little estate , ” as old Nelson used to call it in apologetic accents .
#Text=A heart permeated by a particular sort of funk is proof against sense , feeling , and ridicule .
#Text=It ’s a flint .

#Text=Jasper would have made his request all the same and then taken his own way ; but it was Freya who decided that nothing should be said , on the ground that , “ Papa would only worry himself to distraction . ”
#Text=He was capable of making himself ill , and then she would n’t have the heart to leave him .
#Text=Here you have the sanity of feminine outlook and the frankness of feminine reasoning .
#Text=And for the rest , Miss Freya could read “ poor dear papa ” in the way a woman reads a man — like an open book .
#Text=His daughter once gone , old Nelson would not worry himself .
#Text=He would raise a great outcry , and make no end of lamentable fuss , but that ’s not the same thing .

#Text=The real agonies of indecision , the anguish of conflicting feelings would be spared to him . And as he was too unassuming to rage , he would , after a period of lamentation , devote himself to his “ little estate , ” and to keeping on good terms with the authorities .
#Text=Time would do the rest .
#Text=And Freya thought she could afford to wait , while ruling over her own home in the beautiful brig and over the man who loved her .
#Text=This was the life for her who had learned to walk on a ship ’s deck .
#Text=She was a ship-child , a sea-girl if ever there was one .
#Text=And of course she loved Jasper and trusted him ; but there was a shade of anxiety in her pride .

#Text=It is very fine and romantic to possess for your very own a finely tempered and trusty sword-blade , but whether it is the best weapon to counter with the common cudgel-play of Fate — that ’s another question .
#Text=She knew that she had the more substance of the two — you need n’t try any cheap jokes , I am not talking of their weights .
#Text=She was just a little anxious while he was away , and she had me who , being a tried confidant , took the liberty to whisper frequently “ The sooner the better . ”
#Text=But there was a peculiar vein of obstinacy in Miss Freya , and her reason for delay was characteristic .
#Text=“ Not before my twenty-first birthday ; so that there shall be no mistake in people ’s minds as to me being old enough to know what I am doing . ”
#Text=Jasper ’s feelings were in such subjection that he had never even remonstrated against the decree .
#Text=She was just splendid , whatever she did or said , and there was an end of it for him .
#Text=I believe that he was subtle enough to be even flattered at bottom — at times .
#Text=And then to console him he had the brig which seemed pervaded by the spirit of Freya , since whatever he did on board was always done under the supreme sanction of his love .
#Text=“ Yes .
#Text=I ’ll soon begin to count the days , ” he repeated .
#Text=“ Eleven months more .
#Text=I ’ll have to crowd three trips into that . ”
#Text=“ Mind you do n’t come to grief trying to do too much , ”
#Text=I admonished him .
#Text=But he dismissed my caution with a laugh and an elated gesture .
#Text=Pooh !

#Text=Nothing , nothing could happen to the brig , he cried , as if the flame of his heart could light up the dark nights of uncharted seas , and the image of Freya serve for an unerring beacon amongst hidden shoals ; as if the winds had to wait on his future , the stars fight for it in their courses ; as if the magic of his passion had the power to float a ship on a drop of dew or sail her through the eye of a needle — simply because it was her magnificent lot to be the servant of a love so full of grace as to make all the ways of the earth safe , resplendent , and easy .
